body: Devastation Trail       Crater Rim Drive Tour - Stop #8       Devastation Trail Follows Alongside of Pu‘u Pua‘i NPS - Ed Shiinoki         Devastation Trail NPS - Ed Shiinoki  Approximately 1/2 mile from Puʻu Puaʻi is the Devastation Trail parking area. You can park your car here and take a 30-minute walk through the cinder outfall of the 1959 eruption of Kīlauea Iki. This 1/2 mile (each way) paved trail is wheelchair and stroller accessible. You can have the driver of your car proceed on to the Puʻu Puaʻi Overlook located 1/2 mile away and meet your group. Another option is to walk the unpaved trail (.6 mile each way) to the Byron Ledge trail across the cinders being reclaimed by a variety of native and alien species.      Go to: Crater Rim Drive Tour - Stop #9 - Hike to Keanakāko'i Crater      Return to: Crater Rim Drive Tour - main page Things to Do
